org.xlattice.corexml.expr

Class Literal

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xlattice.corexml.expr.Expr
      • org.xlattice.corexml.expr.Literal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Token

    public class Literal
extends Expr
implements Token
    A literal, a token representing a singly or doubly quoted string.
    Author:
    Jim Dixon

    • Constructor Detail

      • Literal

        public Literal(java.lang.String text)
        Accept a double or single quoted literal. The quotation marks are not passed to the constructor. In this implementation, characters are not escaped here; the text passed must be well-formed. No attempt is made to deal with ${} constructs.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if text is null

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public java.lang.String getValue()
        Returns:
        a reference to the unquoted String value of the literal

        protected java.lang.String xmlBody(int indent)
        Specified by:
        xmlBody in class Expr
        Returns:
        the literal in a form suitable for XML output
